III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff person 1 choked Youth A after Youth A bit and hit him.
Investigation Complainant
I spoke with Complainant on 08/31/2023 by phone. Complainant
stated Youth A alleged Staff person 1 choked him. Complainant
stated he could not tell if Youth A had marks from this incident
because a shirt was wrapped around Youth A’s head like a turban
and he carried a wet floor sign over his head. Complainant stated
law enforcement came to Wolverine Center and transported Youth
A to Wayne County Juvenile Detention.
Youth A
I attempted to interview Youth A at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention on 09/01/2023, but he was discharged to a foster home
placement on 08/31/2023. Approval was given by Department of
Child Welfare director to interview Youth A by video conference. I
interviewed Youth A by video conference on 09/15/2023. Youth A
stated Staff person 1 told him to watch his boundaries and not be
“in his face.” Youth A stated Staff person 1 grabbed Youth A’s
throat with one hand and pushed Youth A against the third-floor
hallway wall. Youth A stated he punched Staff person 1 in the
stomach twice and ran downstairs and informed Supervisor 1 that
he was choked. Youth A stated Supervisor 1 directed him to sit in
the first-floor lounge. Youth A stated he was not injured and does
not have marks from the choke hold. Youth A stated he could
breathe and talk during the choke hold. Youth A stated law
enforcement transported him to Wayne County Juvenile Detention
the day of this incident.
Youth B
I interviewed Youth B on 09/05/2023 at Wolverine Center with
another Department of Health and Human Service worker
because he was on the third floor at the time of the incident per
2

Wolverine Center documentation. Youth B stated Youth A and
Staff person 1 were at the other end of the hallway on the third
floor and he did not see the incident between them.
Youth C
I interviewed Youth C on 09/05/2023 at Wolverine Center with
another Department of Health and Human Service worker
because he was on the third floor at the time of the incident per
Wolverine documentation. Youth C stated he saw Youth A hit Staff
person 1 on the arms. Youth C stated Staff person 1 blocked
Youth A’s hits and called for assistance. Youth C stated this
happened on the third-floor hallway.
Staff person 1
I interviewed Staff person 1 with another Department of Health
and Human Service worker and reviewed his personnel file on
09/05/2023 at Wolverine Center. Staff person 1 stated Youth A
was on medical precaution and acted erratic during the shift by
wrapping a shirt overing his head with the collar opening over his
eyes to see. Staff person 1 stated Youth A told Staff person 1 to
go die in a hole and pushed, shoved, and charged at him. Staff
person 1 stated Youth A did not respond to redirection to watch
his boundaries and Staff person 1 stretched out his arm to form a
boundary with Youth A, but Youth A pushed his arm down. Staff
person 1 stated he placed Youth A in a one person standing hold
and Youth A tried to head bump him in the head. Staff person 1
stated he released Youth A and Youth A punched him in the
stomach multiple times and until he placed Youth A in another
standing hold. Staff person 1 stated Youth A screamed “let go”, bit
Staff person 1’s left arm, and was released. Staff person 1 stated
Youth A banged and moved a chair in the hallway and ran down
the stairs. Staff person 1 stated he walked out of the building,
went to the parking lot, and called law enforcement. Staff person 1
stated he saw Youth A in the first-floor lounge waving a yellow wet
floor caution sign. Staff person 1 stated he heard Youth A allege
Staff person 1 choked him. Staff person 1 stated he did not choke
Youth A. I observed a healing bite mark on Staff person 1’s left
arm.
Staff person 2
I was unable to reach Staff person 2 on 09/11/2023 and
09/26/2023 by phone, but interviewed Staff person 2 on
09/29/2023 by phone. Staff person 2 stated she recalled the
incident between Youth A and Staff person 1. Staff person 2
stated she was in the hallway with Youth B and Youth C when
Youth A was irate and not following Staff person 1’s redirection to
3

remain on the third floor. Staff person 2 stated Staff person 1
stretched out his arm towards Youth A when Youth A became
aggressive and swung and hit Staff person 1. Staff person 2
stated she called for assistance and removed the youths away
from the situation. Staff person 2 stated seeing Staff person 1
attempt a one person standing hold with Youth A, but was unable
due to Youth A swinging his arms, kicking his feet, and biting Staff
person 1’s arm. Staff person 1 denied seeing Staff person 1 choke
Youth A. Staff person 2 was asked if Staff person 1’s stretched out
arm touched Youth A. Staff person 2 stated it is possible Staff
person 1’s stretched out arm touched Youth A because Youth A
was moving towards Staff person 1 to hit him.
Supervisor 1
I interviewed Supervisor 1 on 09/05/2023 at Wolverine Center with
another Department of Health and Human Service worker.
Supervisor 1 stated she observed Youth A yelling that Staff
person 1 choked him. Supervisor 1 stated she directed Youth A to
sit down by the front office and got Supervisor 2 and Supervisor 3
to speak with him because they were on duty and she just arrived
for her shift. Supervisor 1 stated law enforcement transported
Youth A to Wayne County Juvenile Detention.
Supervisor 2
I interviewed Supervisor 2 on 09/05/2023 at Wolverine Center with
another Department of Health and Human Service worker.
Supervisor 2 stated Youth A came down the stairs from the third
floor and stated Staff person 1 choked him. Supervisor 2 stated
she did not observe any marks on Youth A. Supervisor 2 stated
she met with Staff person 1 and Staff person 1 stated he
performed a one person standing hold on Youth A after Youth A
punched him.
Supervisor 3
I interviewed Supervisor 3 on 09/05/2023 at Wolverine Center with
another Department of Health and Human Service worker.
Supervisor 3 stated Youth A pounded on a door and cried that
Staff person 1 choked him. Supervisor 3 stated she spoke with
Staff person 1 and Staff person 1 told her that Youth A was in his
personal space and bumped him and bit through skin on his arm
and did not choke Youth A. Supervisor 3 stated law enforcement
took Youth A to Wayne County Juvenile Detention for assaulting
Staff person 1.
Documentation
4

Wolverine Center incident report dated 08/29/2023 at 2:50 pm
written by Staff person 1 states Youth A wore a shirt over his
head, punched Staff person 1 in the stomach and bit Staff person
1’s arm. It states Youth A was redirected and Staff person 1
extended his arm in a protective stance and called for assistance.
It states Youth A was placed in a standing hold twice. It states
Youth A threw chairs, punched the door, and ran down the back
stairs to the front office. It states Staff person 1 left the unit and
went outside and called law enforcement. It states Youth A
alleged he was choked. It states law enforcement took Youth A to
Wayne County Juvenile Detention.
Youth A was at Wayne County Juvenile Detention from
08/29/2023 to 08/31/2023. Youth A’s initial nursing assessment
dated 08/30/2023 states Youth A was calm and responsive and
does not indicate Youth A had marks on his neck.
Video
I reviewed the video of the incident on 09/20/2023. The video
footage at 2:40 pm on 08/29/2023 shows Youth A has a shirt
wrapped over his head and runs into Staff person 1. It shows
Youth A points at Staff person 1 and Staff person 1 extends his
arm horizontally out towards Youth A. It shows Youth A pushes
Staff person 1 on his upper chest. It shows Staff person 1 stands
behind Youth A to place him in a hold, but Youth A and Staff
person 1 move to a corner by the door, which is blind spot for the
video camera. Video footage from another angle shows when the
door is opened that Youth A paces and hits Staff person 1. Video
footage shows Youth A and Staff person 1 return through the door
and is in camera view. It shows Youth A runs down the hallway,
pushes a heavy, residential chair down the hallway, turns around
and runs back down the hallway to the stairwell at 2:42 pm. Staff
person 2 and Youth C are standing in the hallway at the start of
video. It shows Staff person 2 making a call. It shows Staff person
2 and Youth C leave the hallway as the situation between Youth A
and Staff person 1 unfolds.
Tour
Walked through Wolverine Center third-floor hallway.
Another Department of Health and Human Service agency
completed an investigation without finding.
Analysis It is not found that Staff person 1 choked Youth A on 08/29/2023
for the following reasons: 1) Youth A stated he was able to
breathe and talk when Staff person 1 choked him. 2) Staff person
5

1 denied choking Youth A and Staff person 2 denied seeing Staff
person 1 choke Youth A. 3) Supervisor 2 stated Youth A did not
have marks on his neck from being choked. 4) Available video
review does not capture Staff person 1 choking Youth A. 5) Youth
A was transported to Wayne County Juvenile Detention on
08/29/2023. Youth A’s initial nursing assessment completed on
08/30/2023 at Wayne County Juvenile Detention does not indicate
Youth A had marks or swelling on his neck.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy.
It is recommended that the current license status be continued.
